## East Whiteland Township, Pennsylvania, Income Tax and Property Tax for Open Space Funding Measure (November 2024)
## East Whiteland Township, Pennsylvania, Income Tax and Property Tax for Open Space Funding Measure (November 2024)

,9.23,21.1,0.6975820004349631,0.9088949959469345,['East Whiteland Township, Pennsylvania, Income Tax and Property Tax for Open Space Funding Measure (November 2024)']","['“Do you favor the imposition of a tax on the earned income of Township Residents at a rate not to exceed five one-hundredths (5/100th) of one percent (.05%) and an increase in the real property tax at a rate not to exceed 0.45 mills ($0.45 per $1,000 assessed valuaton) for the purpose of preserving natural resources, maintaining wildlife habitat, protecing environmentally sensitive areas, and providing recreational lands by the Township of East Whiteland to be used to retire indebtedness incurred in purchasing interests in or acquisition of real property for natural resource protection, open space preservation, and public recreation?”']","# Ballot for Chester County, Pennsylvania
## East Whiteland Township, Pennsylvania, Income Tax and Property Tax for Open Space Funding Measure (November 2024)

“Do you favor the imposition of a tax on the earned income of Township Residents at a rate not to exceed five one-hundredths (5/100th) of one percent (.05%) and an increase in the real property tax at a rate not to exceed 0.45 mills ($0.45 per $1,000 assessed valuaton) for the purpose of preserving natural resources, maintaining wildlife habitat, protecing environmentally sensitive areas, and providing recreational lands by the Township of East Whiteland to be used to retire indebtedness incurred in purchasing interests in or acquisition of real property for natural resource protection, open space preservation, and public recreation?”

## East Whiteland Township, Pennsylvania, Income Tax and Property Tax for Open Space Funding Measure (November 2024)

“Do you favor the imposition of a tax on the earned income of Township Residents at a rate not to exceed five one-hundredths (5/100th) of one percent (.05%) and an increase in the real property tax at a rate not to exceed 0.45 mills ($0.45 per $1,000 assessed valuaton) for the purpose of preserving natural resources, maintaining wildlife habitat, protecing environmentally sensitive areas, and providing recreational lands by the Township of East Whiteland to be used to retire indebtedness incurred in purchasing interests in or acquisition of real property for natural resource protection, open space preservation, and public recreation?”
